Package org.ddolib.examples.mcp

package org.ddolib.examples.mcp
This package implements the acs, astar and ddo models for the Maximum Cut Problem (MCP). Given an undirected weighted graph ğº = (ğ‘‰,ğ¸) in which the weight of the edge (ğ‘–,ğ‘—) âˆˆ ğ¸ is denoted ğ‘¤_{i,j} the MCP consists in finding a bi-partition (ğ‘†,ğ‘‡) of the vertices of some given graph that maximizes the total weight of edges whose endpoints are in different partitions. This problem is considered in the papers:
  • David Bergman et al. Decision Diagrams for Optimization. Ed. by Barry Oâ€™Sullivan and Michael Wooldridge. Springer, 2016.
  • David Bergman et al. â€œDiscrete Optimization with Decision Diagramsâ€. In: INFORMS Journal on Computing 28.1 (2016), pp. 47â€“66.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.ddolib.examples
    Package containing examples
  • Class
    Description
    Graph
    Represents a Graph with adjacency matrix.
    MCPAcsMain
    Maximum Cut Problem (MCP) with Acs.
    MCPAstarMain
    Maximum Cut Problem (MCP) with AsTar.
    MCPDdoMain
    Main class for solving the Maximum Cut Problem (MCP) using a DDO (Decision Diagram Optimization) approach.
    MCPFastLowerBound
    Implementation of fast lower bound heuristic for the MCP.
    MCPGenerator
    Contains methods to generates and write instances.
    MCPProblem
    Represents an instance of the Maximum Cut Problem (MCP).
    MCPRanking
    Class used to compare two states for the MCP problem.
    MCPRelax
    Implements a relaxation strategy for the Maximum Cut Problem (MCP).
    MCPState
    Class to contain data for the MCP state.
    NaiveMCPSolver
    Naive MCP solver which enumerates all the solution to find the best one.
